meanings.sent1: She had to unboot her muddy boots before entering the house.
meanings.sent2: After a long hike, he unbooted his tired feet and felt relief.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy knight accidentally unbooted himself in front of the king.
meanings.sent4: In the fairy tale, the magical spell could unboot anyone who dared to enter the forbidden forest.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's power was to unboot villains with a single touch, leaving them powerless.

meanings.sent1: The unboot hiker struggled to walk on the snowy trail.
meanings.sent2: She felt the cold ground beneath her unboot feet.
meanings.sent3: The unboot explorer realized too late that boots were essential in the swamp.
meanings.sent4: The unboot soldier had to wrap his feet in cloth to protect them.
meanings.sent5: His unboot toes wiggled freely in the warm sand at the beach.

meanings.definition: To start up a computer without loading an operating system.
meanings.sent1: He had to unboot the computer to access the BIOS settings.
meanings.sent2: The technician needed to unboot the system to troubleshoot the issue.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student tried to unboot the school computers as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The hacker's virus caused the computer to unboot repeatedly.
meanings.sent5: In a rush, she accidentally unbooted the computer and lost all her work.
